review_title: Small campus with a big heart
job_title: Director of Human Resources in Franklin Springs, GA
pros: Small, Christ-centered, & caring; encourage employees to better themselves.
cons: You have to be the right-fit to enjoy working here.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Franklin Springs, GA
pros: Effective COVID screening and option to take COVID test on campus if needed.
cons: Supervisors were out most of the time “working from home” but were mostly inaccessible and did not value work/life balance. If you had a doctors appointment you had to work it around supervisors and coworkers schedules. Was told by a supervisor that I couldn’t have overtime when there was an (mandatory) event on campus on a weekend so had take hours off during the week to make up for it. Supervisors weren’t sure what went on in the day to day office operations and departments had little to no communication. Pay was nearly half of what other colleges were paying for the same position. Pay does not equal work load making employees feel burned out. Supervisors picked favorites and were very lenient with those employees but strict with others. Very heavy on appearances. Little to no diversity with staff/faculty.

review_title: A great company ruined by antiquated ideals.
job_title: Office Administrator in Franklin Springs, GA
cons: Employees are paid 1/3 an average higher education salary but often hold more than two job titles with far too many responsibilities. Employees are often overworked and underpaid with little work life balance. Higher ups rely heavily on antiquated beliefs and systems despite younger staff members providing incredibly beneficial new ideas that would grow the campus. The work environment is often toxic as anything that is going wrong in your department as blame gets passed off as the fault of those lower in the hierarchy.

job_title: KEY NOT FOUND: reviews.reserve-anonymous in Carnesville, GA
pros: Christian based private school with great atmosphere
cons: None that come to mind now

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Franklin Springs, GA
pros: great organization overall with strong staff and leadership
cons: the pay is fairly low for the industry
